data.title: Amerika-mura (Amemura)
data.meta_description: Amerika-mura's warren of narrow streets is at the heart of Osaka's youth culture, with dozens of shops catering to fans of urban apparel and hip-hop wear.
data.text:
Amerika-mura - or Amemura to the locals - is a warren of narrow streets which is at the heart of youth culture in Osaka, with dozens of shops catering to fans of urban apparel and hip-hop wear. But even if you’re not clothes-shopping, there are plenty of foreigner-friendly bars and restaurants in the area.

Amerika-mura - image © Florentyna Leow

If you’re a fashionista - or a fashion victim - in your 20s, Amerika Mura (or “Amemura” to the locals) may be right up your alley. With a name that translates to “America Village,” Amemura has been at the heart of youth culture in Osaka since the 1970s.

Amerika-mura - image © Florentyna Leow

Even today, this warren of narrow streets draws teenagers and early-20s fashionistas in flocks for its shops stocked with urban apparel, hip-hop wear, and vintage clothing.

Amerika-mura - image © Florentyna Leow

Amemura is located on the west side of Midosuji, just north of the Dotombori Canal. Centered around Sankaku-koen Park (Triangle Park), a concrete rest area surrounded by retail shops, Amemura is a great place to wander around, watch people, spot unusual outfits, and shop for your own wacky clothes.

Amerika-mura - image © Florentyna Leow

There are plenty of cafes, bars and restaurants in the area, most of which are welcoming to foreigners. If you’re looking for non-Japanese food, this is also the neighbourhood to visit, as there’s a relatively high density of “international” food in this area - pancakes, burgers, pizza, and third-wave coffee are just some of the options you’ll find in Amemura. Weekends see long queues at the takoyaki shop at one corner of the park - try the lemon and black pepper version - and performances and flea markets for a fun and lively atmosphere.

English name:

Amerikamura

Japanese name:

アメリカ村

English address:

Nishi-shinsaibashi, Chuo-ku, Osaka-shi, 542-0086

Japanese address:

〒542-0086 大阪市中央区西心斎橋

Opening hours:

Varies by shop

Admission:

free

Nearest Transport:

Subway: Directly connected to exit 7 of Shinsaibashi Station on the Osaka Metro Midosuji and Nagahori Tsurumi-ryokuchi Lines.

Nearest Hotels:

:: Check availability and pricing for hotels near Amerikamura on Booking.com or Agoda.com.

Telephone:

none

Website:

Official Website (English)
